## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**AI Assistant:**
Hey there! I'm here to help you understand Verus. What's on your mind today?

**User:**
I'm curious about mobile support in Verus. What's the priority for mobile support in the Verus project, and what features are planned for the mobile experience?

**AI Assistant:**
Mobile support is a high priority for Verus, and the planned mobile experience is intended to provide a convenient way for users to use, earn, and spend Verus in their daily lives. The mobile experience will function as a wallet, self-sovereign identity, and provide easy access to polling and earning applications. It will also serve as an extensible application browser, capable of supporting additional applications that leverage the Komodo or compatible ecosystems.

**User:**
That sounds really cool! When can we expect the first mobile experiences to be ready, and what features will they include?

**AI Assistant:**
The first mobile experiences are not expected to be ready until the completion of the project's second phase at the earliest. Initially, these mobile experiences will not include support for private transactions, which are planned to be enabled as a foundation for confidential, mobile polling and communications in the future.

**User:**
I'm curious about the technical side of Verus. How did the Verus project decide to implement its technology, and what existing technologies will it leverage?

**AI Assistant:**
After researching various options, the Verus project decided to start building its technology as a friendly fork of Komodo and its asset chain technology. This approach allows Verus to both become a contributing member of and enhance and extend the Komodo platform as it builds its own blockchain platform technologies and real-world applications of PBaaS. Verus will leverage proven zk-SNARK zero-knowledge privacy technologies and Komodo's delayed proof of work (dPoW) to underpin its blockchain with a foundation of security and trust.
What is the priority for mobile support in the Verus project, and what features are planned for the mobile experience?

Mobile support is a high priority for Verus, and the planned mobile experience is intended to provide a convenient way for users to use, earn, and spend Verus in their daily lives. The mobile experience will function as a wallet, self-sovereign identity, and provide easy access to polling and earning applications. It will also serve as an extensible application browser, capable of supporting additional applications that leverage the Komodo or compatible ecosystems.

In addition to a desktop wallet that supports Verus and other Komodo platforms or compatible applications, mobile support is a high priority and will provide yet another layer of
convenience for users, enabling them to use, earn, and spend Verus in everyday life. We intend to provide a Verus mobile experience that functions as a wallet, self-sovereign identity,
provides easy access to the polling and earning applications, and is intended to server as an
extensible application browser, capable of supporting additional applications that leverage
the Komodo or compatible ecosystems. While we have already begun thinking about and
storyboarding design and development of user experiences, we do not expect any mobile
experience to be ready until completion of Phase II at the earliest. Even when the first
mobile experiences are ready, they will not include the support for private transactions that
we intend to enable as a foundation for confidential, mobile polling and communications. To
get a feel for the way we envision Verus experiences working in practice, below is an example
of some poll screens from early designs.

4

Implementation and Roadmap

After researching options from building the technology ourselves to leveraging unreleased
advanced projects, to using one of the few well thought through blockchain application
platforms, we decided to start building the Verus project as a friendly fork of Komodo and
its asset chain technology, enabling us to both become a contributing member of and also
enhance and extend the Komodo platform as Verus builds blockchain platform technologies
and real world applications of PBaaS.
By leveraging proven zk-SNARK zero knowledge privacy technologies and Komodo’s
delayed proof of work (dPoW), which notarizes the main Verus blockchain into Komodo’s
blockchain, which is then notarized into the Bitcoin blockchain, we underpin Verus with a
founda
